name: NIDHOGG
description: A prototype compact version of ASGARD's intimidating Nidhogg-class Autonomous Dreadnought, the "Nidhogg Junior" was created by engineers working at the Kykrfjall foundry on Niflheim. While the reduction in size makes it far more viable for widespread use, concessions to the mech's internal architecture ensured that the frame never saw an actual commercial release. Nonetheless, plans for the mech made their way to the public after a crew of pilots returned to the abandoned foundry and found the hitherto unused schematics buried in a dusty server deep within the bowels of the facility.

traits.name: Heavy Frame
traits.description: The Nidhogg canâ€™t be pushed, pulled, knocked Prone, or knocked back by smaller characters.

traits.name: "Nastrond" Point Defense Subsystem
traits.description: Adjacent allied characters gain soft cover, even in the open.

traits.name: Thermal Engine Recycling
traits.description: Once per mission, when taking Stress damage, you may choose to not make a Overheat roll. This does not prevent the damage, and all Heat is cleared as though you Overheated normally.

traits.name: Alpha Retrofit
traits.description: The Nidhogg receives +1 Difficulty on AGILITY and ENGINEERING checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Nidhogg gains +1 Difficulty on AGILITY checks and saves.
The Nidhogg gains +1 Difficulty on ENGINEERING checks and saves.

core_system.name: Roots of Yggdrasil V2.07
core_system.description: Rather than being a single weapon, the Roots of Yggdrasil are a suite of autonomous cannons and turrets mounted around the entire body of the Nidhogg, capable of suppressing a large area or focusing down a single high priority target. Though this variant suite is far less powerful than the original, the redesign doesn't require the same access to a dedicated foundry that the original relied upon to keep all two-hundred and fourteen of its turrets supplied.
core_system.active_effect: Activate the Roots of Yggdrasil's Annihilation Mode.

name: FENRIR
description:
The utility of ASGARD's Fenrir model has always been in question. A mech designed in such a way that the pilot puts themself in maximum danger to eke out a tiny extra bit of effectiveness in combat doesn't seem, on its surface, that it would appeal to many pilots. Indeed, it doesn't. However, to a specific kind of pilot, with just enough bravery and a touch of insanity, the Fenrir's integrated battlesuit offers enough utility and safety to be incredibly appealing. As such, despite many, many attempts by the Outer Arm Frontier Sector Administration to discourage the production of the Fenrir, it has remained in steady, if limited, production since it was first conceived.
"It's like ASGARD read stories about the stupid shit Lancers pull and designed a Mech based on that."

traits.name: Call of the Wild
traits.description: Pilots may mount and dismount from the Fenrir as a quick action instead of a full action.

traits.name: Fenriswolf-Class Integrated NHP
traits.description:
The Fenrir gains the AI tag, if it doesn't already have it from its systems.
While you are wearing the Tyr Battlesuit, as long as it is not in Emergency Standby, any NHP that pilots your mech benefits from your talents.

traits.name: Weak Computer
traits.description: The Fenrir receives +1 Difficulty on all SYSTEM saves and checks.

synergies.detail: The Fenrir receives +1 Difficulty on all SYSTEM saves and checks.

core_system.name: WARWOLVES
core_system.description: The Revision Two ASG-BERSERK system is a complex network of neural jacks and chemical injectors within the Tyr Battlesuit that allows the pilot of the mech to control and communicate with it at the speed of thought, effectively allowing the pilot to control the mech in the same way as an NHP. Pilots who use the system have reported feeling a strong connection to the NHPs installed on their mech, and have more than once referred to them as their "pack". Medical and psychological analysis of said pilots show no significant or unexpected divergance from a typical pilot's neural patterns, and so the phenomenon is largely attributed to the eccentricity of mech pilots and the name of the frame, itself.
core_system.active_effect: Immediately recharge ASG-BERSERK Stimulant Injection. For the rest of the scene, whenever you attack with the Wolfstooth, the Fenrir may Overwatch your target.
core_system.passive_effect:
When you dismount from the Fenrir for any reason, you may choose to exit while wearing the linked Tyr Battlesuit, instead of your normal Hardsuit. Doing so offers several benefits as long as the Battlesuit is worn:
  • Your speed is increased to match the Fenrir's.
  • You gain an HP boost of 5. This bonus HP is inherent to the Battlesuit, and is not regained each time you exit the mech if it was previously lost.
  • You gain 2 Armor.
  • Your Evasion and E-Defense are increased to 11.
  • You have Resistance to damage and Burn from attacks that target more than one character.
  • You gain access to the ASG-BERSERK Stimulant Injection Reaction and the Wolfstooth weapon.
However, the Battlesuit needs to draw power from the Fenrir to function. If you end your turn more than range 5 away from the Fenrir, or if the Fenrir is destroyed, your Battlesuit enters Emergency Standby: you are Immobilized and Jammed until the Fenrir comes back into range or until you exit the Battlesuit as a Full Action. In addition, any Tech Actions that affect the Fenrir affect the Tyr Battlesuit, as well.

passive_actions.name: ASG-BERSERK Stimulant Injection
passive_actions.trigger: You would be reduced to 0 HP while wearing the Tyr Battlesuit.
passive_actions.detail:
You regain all HP and clear any Burn affecting you.
If you have already used this reaction during this scene, you may mark a repair when you Stabilize while directly piloting the Fenrir to "recharge" it, allowing you to use it again in the same scene.

name: JORMUNGANDR
description: ASGARD developed the Jormungandr frame on technology recovered from damaged HORUS Hydra pattern group mechs. While the utility of the Hydra's suite of drones was appealing to ASGARD's engineers, ASGARD insisted that they design its variation to meet the needs of defense enterprises that wanted a more straightforward mech. The resulting frame far exceeded ASGARD's typical technical specifications, and ASGARD began to heavily push it as their primary frontline mech in an attempt to recover from their disastrous investment in their Niflheim Mining and Research Initiative. Still reeling from their financial losses, ASGARD is relying on the Jormungandr's success to snatch them from the jaws of bankruptcy and obsolecence.

traits.name: Ouroboros
traits.description: 1/Round the Jormungandr may swap places with one of its Deployables or Drones.

actions.name: Ouroboros
actions.detail: As long as you aren't Immobilized or Slowed, choose one of your Deployables or Drones within Range 10. You teleport to its location, and it simultaneously teleports to your original location. If the chosen Deployable was an armed Mine, it immediately triggers.

traits.name: Ophidian Rage
traits.description: 1/Scene, when a Deployable or Drone placed by the Jormungandr is destroyed, it can deploy a Deployable or Drone as a Reaction.

traits.name: Amputation
traits.description: While the Jormungandr has no undestroyed and undeployed weapons installed on it, it is considered size 1/2.

traits.name: Specialized Weapon Mounts
traits.description: The Jormungandr cannot install Superheavy weapons for any reason. No rule supercedes this.

core_system.name: "Serpent's Head" Remote Weapons Platform
core_system.description: When you alone are not enough, Jormungandr is there to help you encircle and protect what matters to you. - ASGARD Promotional Material
core_system.active_effect: Deploy a Serpent's Head turret for one weapon on each of your mounts. These Serpent's Heads do not disable the mount they are deployed from and have no negative effects when they are destroyed.
core_system.passive_effect:
As a quick action, you can separate a weapon from the Jormungandr, deploying it as a Serpent's Head turret.
When you deploy a Serpent's Head choose one of your weapons. As long as the Serpent's Head is deployed, you cannot use the mount that weapon was mounted on for normal attacks or to deploy other Serpent's Heads. Instead, that weapon is mounted on the Serpent's Head for use with the Snakebite reaction, which can be taken once per Round for each deployed Serpent's Head. Your Serpent's Heads share your E-Defense and Evasion, and reload weapons mounted on them when you do. When a Serpent's Head is destroyed, destroy the mount that its weapon was taken from.

deployables.name: Serpent's Head
deployables.detail: Gain the Snakebite reaction, which can be taken 1/round per deployed Serpent's Head.

actions.name: Snakebite
actions.trigger: You or an ally make an attack against an enemy within range of the weapon on this Serpent's Head.
actions.detail: Make an attack with the weapon mounted on this Serpent's Head, originating from its location, against the targeted enemy.

actions.name: Recombine
actions.detail: Reclaim an adjacent Serpent's Head into your mech, undeploying it and regaining normal use of the mount. If you reclaim a damaged Serpent's Head, you may not use that mount to deploy a new Serpent's Head until you Stabilize.

name: DRAUGR
description: To anyone who reads this: the Draugr was not intended for release. If you want the benefits of ASGARD's work on the ASG-BERSERK system to make it safe long-term, get a Fenrir, instead. It doesn't have the same side effects as this thing's version. The patterns here were only ever prototypes, and while they do work, in a sense, the whole project was shadowed by mechanical failure, injury, and death. If that's not enough to dissuade you, so be it. I only maintain these licenses as a matter of personal pride as the former director of the project and as a monument to the things we accomplished, good and bad. Whatever happens from here is your own damn fault.

traits.name: Martial Subroutines
traits.description: The Draugr may make an Improvised Attack as a quick action, instead of a full action. The Draugr's Improvised Attacks deal 3d3 Kinetic damage instead of 1d6. If you have a talent or system that also changes the damage and effects of Improvised Attacks, you may choose which profile to use.

traits.name: Walking Dead
traits.description: If the Draugr takes damage that would reduce it to 0 HP on any turn except its own, it instead falls to 1 HP and any excess damage is prevented. Until the end of the Draugr's next turn, any further damage it would take (after reductions like Armor or Resistance) is stored. At the end of the Draugr's next turn, it loses 1 Structure (and makes a Structure roll) and fully heals, then immediately takes all stored damage.

traits.name: Unstable Targeting System
traits.description: The Draugr gets -2 to on all Ranged attack rolls.

core_system.name: ASG-BERSERK REVISION ZERO
core_system.active_effect:
This action may only be taken if you are physically present in the Draugr. Until the end of combat:
  • You cannot make Ranged attacks.
  • You cannot take or be affected by tech actions, friendly or hostile.
  • Your Improvised Attacks gain +1 Accuracy, deal 1d3 bonus Kinetic damage and cannot have their damage reduced in any way.
  • You ignore the normal restrictions on duplicate actions for Inprovised Attacks.
  • At the end of each of your turns, if you did deal damage with an attack, the Draugr's Pilot takes 3 Energy damage.
If you, the pilot, are killed or knocked Down and Out, the Draugr begins to pilot itself, as though it was controlled by a cascading NHP.

It is, however, not controlled by an NHP: just the echoes of the pilot's last, panicked thoughts.

name: VIRTUOSO
description:
The Virtuoso is the only mech frame that Lumiera Corporation has produced for widespread release, if you can consider a release to a hand-vetted waitlist of pilots 'widespread'. It's gaudy, over-engineered, and ludicrously expensive, and yet, hordes of pilots clamber over one another to wait on a list for access to its license. Merely possessing this mech tells a potential employer, "If I couldn't do everything I claim, Lumiera would have never let me pilot one of their precious mechs." After all, Lumiera's standards are astronomical, both for the capabilities of their own mechs and of the pilots that use them.
Note: Wings are for display purposes only. Lumiera Corporation requests that pilots disconnect the Virtuoso's wings before combat use.

traits.name: Dissonance
traits.description: When the Virtuoso successfully Invades an enemy, it gains +1 Accuracy on all Ranged attacks against that target until the end of its turn.

traits.name: Harmony
traits.description: The Virtuoso still benefits from and can take tech actions while Jammed.

core_system.name: "CAPTIVE AUDIENCE" Theory Engine
core_system.description: In this moment, an evil man stands above the beaten and broken hero, mighty and seemingly invulnerable... but the Play has entered its Third Act. He does not know it, but in thisâ€”his moment of greatest triumphâ€”he has already lost.
core_system.active_effect: Delivers a single-use payload of code so destructive that it shatters a Mech's defenses. Gain an Act die, 1d6 starting at 3. Choose a character within Sensors: their Armor, Evasion and E-Defence are reduced to 0. 1/Round, at the end of each of their turns, reduce the value of the Act die by 1. When the Act die's value would reduced to 0, the effect ends.

name: PHILOSOPHER
description:
START BOOT SEQUENCE... ->
USING LUMIERA CORPORATION MECH FRAMEWORK 209.1 "PHILOSOPHER"... ->
NOTE: THIS IS PROPRIETARY EXPERIMENTAL TECHNOLOGY... ->
IMPROPER USE OF CAUSALITY ENGINE MAY RESULT IN TEMPORAL ERASURE... ->
IF YOU BELIEVE YOU SHOULD NOT HAVE ACCESS TO THIS SYSTEM, PLEASE CONTACT AN ADMINISTRATOR... ->
ACTIVATING CAUSALITY ENGINE NOVA... ->
CAUSALITY RECORDER ACTIVE... ->
TIMELINE ALTERATION READY... ->
GO. ->

traits.name: Causality Micro-Fracture
traits.description: 1/Round the Philosopher may activate NOVA to cause an event to repeat.

actions.name: REQUEST: REPEAT SEQUENCE
actions.trigger:
Any other character within Sensors takes one of the following actions:
  • Makes a weapon attack that does not use a Superheavy weapon.
  • Takes a Quick Tech action, either on its own or as a part of a Full Tech action.
  • Boosts, Rams, or Grapples.
  • Activates a System as a Quick Action.
.
actions.detail: That character immediately takes the same action again as a free action. They do not need to choose the same target, but they must use the same systems/weapons and use the same profile, if applicable. If an attack was made with a Loading weapon, the target may attack with it even with the weapon unloaded. Limited systems and weapons act as though they expended a single charge without actually doing so. You may only take 1 quick action on your next turn, and you may not take full actions on your next turn.

traits.name: Slow
traits.description: The Philosopher gets +1 Difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Philosopher gains +1 Difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

core_system.name: "NOVA" Perfect Causality Engine
core_system.description:
READY ->
I WILL GRANT YOU ONE WISH... ->
3... 2... 1... GO! ->
core_system.active_effect: NOVA prepares to alter the passage of time on a larger scale. At the start of your next turn gain a Miracle die, 1d6 starting at 3, and enter a transcendent state: you gain immunity to all effects, hostile and friendy, and access to a suite of powerful actions. During your turn, you may take no movement or actions except ones provided by this system and REQUEST: REPEAT SEQUENCE, which does not prevent you from taking Full Actions during this time. Each time you use one of the actions granted by this die, reduce the Miracle die by 1. When the Miracle die's value would be reduced to 0, this effect ends.

active_actions.name: REQUEST: AVERT SEQUENCE
active_actions.detail: Restore an ally in Sensors to full HP and clear all Heat, Burn and conditions affecting them, or restore a destroyed ally Mech to a functioning state with full HP, no Heat, 1 STRUCTURE and 1 STRESS. The pilot of that mech is returned to the cockpit, alive, even if they died.

active_actions.name: REQUEST: ALTER SEQUENCE
active_actions.trigger: An ally within Sensors is damaged by an attack.
active_actions.detail: The damage from the attack is prevented. That ally teleports to any space where they could validly attack the attacker, then immediately attacks the target with a valid weapon. You may not take actions on your next turn.

active_actions.name: REQUEST: ENHANCE SEQUENCE
active_actions.detail: Target hostile character within Sensors is Stunned and Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: TRAILBLAZER
description: The colonists of the Outer Arm are practical people, with no need or patience for the typical theatrical flair of the Lumiera Corporation. This proved to be an issue for the company, who had built their reputation on the idea that the greatest adventurers and pilots sought out their mechs as a prize. In an effort to convice the pioneers of the Outer Arm of their value, Lumiera Corporation developed the Trailblazer, released to specific individuals that the company deemed "of interest", built using practical designs that lacked some of the usual flair of Lumiera's other mechs. Whether its reception will lead to further release, only time will tell.

traits.name: Manifest Destiny
traits.description: 1/Round as a free action, as long as the Trailblazer isn't Immobilized or Slowed, it may move up to its Speed towards an enemy.

actions.name: Manifest Destiny
actions.detail: As long as you aren't Immobilized or Slowed, move up to your Speed towards an enemy.

traits.name: Burning Heart
traits.description: 1/Round, when the Trailblazer gains Heat from any source other than Overcharging, it deals 2 bonus Burn damage on its next successful non-Tech attack that turn. The action that generated the Heat does not benefit from this effect (e.g. if a Skirmish taken by the Trailblazer causes it to gain Heat from one of the weapons used, it does not benefit from this effect until all attacks made during that Skirmish completely resolve.)

traits.name: Bloody Flux
traits.description: Whenever the Trailblazer begins a movement, if it was not part of the Trailblazer's standard movement, it gains 2 Heat. This cannot be reduced or prevented by any means.

core_system.name: "PIONEER" Combat Engine
core_system.description:
"Go West, Pioneer, go West,
With your gun in hand,
Go West, Pioneer, go West,
And take the Promised Land."
core_system.passive_effect:
Gain a Verse die, 1d6 beginning at 3.
1/Turn, when the Trailblazer deals damage with a melee or ranged attack, the value of the Verse die decreases by 1 if either:
  • The Trailblazer already dealt damage with with the opposite type this round (e.g., if the Trailblazer deals damage with a melee attack after it dealt damage with a ranged attack.)
  • Or, the Trailblazer deals bonus damage with Burning Heart.
When the die would be reduced to 0, the Trailblazer immediately makes a special attack with a single weapon against an enemy within Range 3. This attack does not count as an action or reaction and ignores Difficulty from all sources. If this attack would damage multiple characters, all characters beyond the first take a maximum of 1 damage from the attack. Then, reset the Verse Die to 3.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, the Verse die is reset to 2 instead of 3 when it is reduced to 0, and whenever the Trailblazer makes a special attack through to the effect of Work Song, the Trailblazer nominates an allied character within Range 15. That character may immediately make an attack following the conditions of Work Song. The Trailblazer may not nominate the same character to receive this effect twice in a row.

name: SLOWPOKE
description:
Independent frames are not available as a part of any license and are only accessible as Exotic Gear.
Sam "Poke" Rodriguez never accepted half measures. As a member of ASGARD's Engineering Research department, he was largely focused on packing the most bang into the smallest frame possible. Though his designs never saw the open market after ASGARD's collapse as a major force in the Outer Arm Frontier sector, Poke went on to refine his designs, ensuring that they would be maximally functional in actual combat. He didn't have a choice after all: he either made his designs work or died trying to use them.

traits.name: Super Stabilizers
traits.description: The Slowpoke cannot be pushed, pulled, or knocked Prone by other characters.

traits.name: Shockwave Disruption
traits.description: 1/Round, when the Slowpoke deals Explosive damage to a Mech, they also take 2 Heat.

traits.name: Weak Computer
traits.description: The Slowpoke receives +1 Difficulty on all SYSTEM saves and checks.

synergies.detail: The Slowpoke receives +1 Difficulty on all SYSTEM saves and checks.

core_system.name: ASG-R44 "Pneuma" Howitzer and Feed System
core_system.description: The "Pnuema" Howitzer is an outsized weapon designed for use on the railways of frontier planets to defend them from bombardment from low-altitude spacecraft. Its raw power is enough to launch a round into orbit, albeit with greatly reduced stopping power, and more than enough to heavily damage any spacecraft within the atmosphere. It was, however, never designed for use on mechs, relying on the incredible mass of a full railway train (with stabilizers) to mitigate the weapon's earth-shattering recoil. Poke viewed this physical limitation not as a concept-killing impossibility, but as a challenge.

passive_actions.name: Quickdraw
passive_actions.detail:
Roll 1d6. On a roll of 6, all of your Loading weapons are immediately reloaded. Otherwise, you are Jammed until the end of your turn.
You may also activate this system as a Protocol. This action may not be taken as a free action for any reason, excluding through its own effect.

core_system.active_effect: Until the end of combat, whenever you attack with a ranged Loading weapon, roll 1d6. On a 6, the weapon reloads itself immediately.

name: BAYHOUND
description:
Independent frames are not available as a part of any license and are only accessible as Exotic Gear.
"Bayhound" Rikishi was an orphan, by its literal meaning, for longer than he could reasonably remember, but he never felt at a loss for family. He was taken in at a young age by the venerable scrapper "Junk Dog" Joe, founder of the Junkyard Dogs, alongside another young man, "Killer Dog" X, who alongside the rest of the scrapper crew, offered him more than enough family for his entire youth. Intent to not be upstaged by his more level-headed adoptive older brother, Rikishi developed a mech that was a brash and loud as him. Never one to rest on his laurels, Rikishi still continually tweaks his self-made Sonic Burst Driver, ever aspiring to reach a legendary status that would secure both his name and the Junkyard Dogs' in history.

traits.name: Pulse Disruption Field
traits.description: 1/scene, when the Bayhound would take Kinetic or Explosive damage, it may gain Immunity to Kinetic and Explosive damage caused by the triggering action.

traits.name: Houndhunt
traits.description: 1/round, when a character becomes Shredded, the Bayhound may move and attack them with the Sonic Burst Driver.

actions.name: Houndhunt
actions.detail: Move up to 3 spaces, then you may make an attack with the Sonic Burst Driver in its HOWL profile. The movement ignores engagement and doesn't provoke reactions, and the attack must target the character that triggered this reaction.

traits.name: Exposed Reactor
traits.description: The Bayhound has +1 Difficulty on Engineering checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Bayhound has +1 Difficulty on Engineering checks and saves.

core_system.name: Sonic Burst Driver
core_system.description: Rikishi's signature weapon, the Sonic Burst Driver, launches high frequency shockwaves from a set of purpose built speakers to damage hostile mechs by literally vibrating them apart with concussive force. A secondary set of high power speakers, the so-called "Deadsteel Amplifiers", dramatically boost the amplitude of the weapon's shockwaves, but cannot be used for long before the mech they're mounted on starts to literally fall to pieces from the intense vibrations.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of combat, the Sonic Burst Driver deals 3 bonus Energy damage on hit and Shreds any target hit until the end of the turn.

name: DOGMA
description:
Independent frames are not available as a part of any license and are only accessible as Exotic Gear.
Markus "Dogma" Brynjar could not have been more different than his father. Though both of them worked for ASGARD, Hakon "Odin" Brynjar had experienced true horror in his life and had chosen a path of isolation to insulate himself from tragedy. Hakon's ability to make hard decisions in times of stress made him a valuable asset to the ASGARD company-as a leader who could be ensured to get results, no matter the situation. Markus too had experienced the horrors of corporate war, of massacres committed by criminal gangs, and of deaths brought about by the sheer hostility of the Outer Arm Frontier Sector. Tragedy, however, merely hardened his resolve to resist the urge to harm those who hated him and to protect anyone he perceived to have even a flicker of innocence. To that end, he built this mech.

traits.name: Intercession
traits.description: 1/round, the Dogma may take attacks in place of its allies.

actions.name: Intercession
actions.trigger: An allied character within Range 5 of you is hit by an attack, and you are not Immobilized or Slowed.
actions.detail: Move to a space adjacent to the targeted character, and you are hit by the attack, instead. Then, you may make a melee attack against the triggering unit, if you are in range.

traits.name: Righteous Indignation
traits.description:
1/turn, when an allied Mech is destroyed, the Dogma immediately takes a turn after this one. This does not count as a friendly or hostile activation. During that turn, the Dogma may only take one quick action, may not take full actions or protocols, and the Dogma gains Avenging Wrath during that turn.
While affected by Avenging Wrath, the Dogma:
  • Ignores the Fiery Revolving Sword's normal restrictions on attacks.
  • May Boost 1/turn as a free action.
  • Has immunity to Immobilized, Slowed, and Jammed.
  • Reduces all damage it takes to 1.

core_system.name: "Absolution" Offensive Thermal Routing System
core_system.description: Defend the weak and the fatherless; uphold the cause of the poor and the oppressed. Rescue the weak and the needy; deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
core_system.active_effect: Immediately take a second turn after this one. This extra turn does not count as a friendly or hostile activation. During this turn and your next, you gain the effects of Avenging Wrath and may only attack with the Fiery Revolving Sword. If you Barrage, you may attack with the Fiery Revolving Sword twice. At the end of your second turn, you are Stunned until the end of your next turn, and then you are Impaired and Slowed until the end of your subsequent turn.
